newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks closed down on selling pressure.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks closed down on selling pressure.

text.p: Dhaka stocks closed down amid selling by retail investors, panicked by looming political uncertainty and worsening law and order, brokers said.

The Dhaka Stock Exchange benchmark index fell 42.28 points or 2.48 percent at 1,660.21 on a turnover of 55.5 million taka. Of 112 traded issues 42 rose and 70 lost. Friday is Weekend in Moslem Bangladesh."The market was nervous following opposition threat to launch anti-government protest and Friday's killing of seven people (near Dhaka) by police firing," said one broker.
National Tubes shed 307 taka to 1,443, Apex Foods lost 79 to 3,643 and Reckitt & Colman rose 23 to 319.
